Problem:
Analyze the stability of the system governed by the differential equation \\(dx/dt = Ax\\), where A is a 2x2 constant matrix. Observe the influence of the transformation defined by \\(g(x) = Px\\), where P is a constant invertible 2x2 matrix, and its effects on the solutions.

If the transformation \\(g(x) = Px\\) is applied initially to a vector \\(x_0\\) and the system evolves as per \\(dx/dt = Ax\\) without further intervention, will \\(x(t)\\) at time t = T be identical to the evolution starting from the vector \\(x_0\\) under the same system dynamics?
Explanation: Applying \\(g(x)\\) changes the initial state from \\(x_0\\) to \\(Px_0\\). The evolution process dictated by \\(dx/dt = Ax\\) will then follow a trajectory from this new initial condition, leading to different results at time T unless P commutes with the exponential of A.
